alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Polk (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 8:25PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Floyd and northwestern Polk Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 824 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Cave Spring, or near Forney, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Cave Spring. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
